loans.use: to stock his store with daily consumer products such as coffee,  tomato sauce, rice, beans, soap, sugar, milk and bread.

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Pamoja Group is located in Kakamega South District. It is a group of 14 women and two men led by Ezina, pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Ezina joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Ezina joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Ezina reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about five bags of maize per acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 18 bags per acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy a cow. Ezina’s group members will each receive input loans of half an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 8 acres of maize and sorghum.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Ana tiene 58 años,  Se dedica a la venta de artículos de “Tienda de Barrio”, en los que vende Azúcar, Arroz, Leche refrescos y Licores que se encuentran en la zona Pabon  de la ciudad de La Paz. Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ana va a usar este préstamo en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, Además de la refacción de su domicilio ya que la época de lluvias a afectado su infraestructura, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que la  cliente necesita el dinero para invertir en su negocio, se animo a solicitar un crédito KIVA debido a los beneficios que le proporciona,  La Sra. Ana enfrenta retos en su negocio que no tiene un buen lugar ya que está un poco oculto de la avenida pero le va muy bien ya que tiene clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios Comprar  mercadería como: Arroz, Azúcar, Fideos, Sopas instantáneas, Refrescos, Jugos y otros a precio mayoritario para ahorrar en la compra y maximizar sus ganancias, su deseo es que  desea mejorar su domicilio,  construir su domicilio y hacerlo más habitable.
texts.en: Ms. Ana is 58 years old. She runs a neighborhood store, where she sells sugar, rice, milk, soft drinks, and liquor that she purchases in the in the Pabon zone in the city of La Paz. This loan is her second cycle with this lending institution. Ms. Ana will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise for her store, as well for the renovation of her home, because the large amount of rain has affected its infrastructure. Her reason for asking for the loan is because she needs money to invest in her business. She was motivated to apply for a Kiva loan because of the benefits it provides. Ms. Ana faces some challenges with her business, such as that her store does not have a good location as it is a little hidden from the main street, but it is doing well nonetheless because she has a good clientele. She will use the loan benefits to buy merchandise such as: rice, sugar, noodles, instant soups, soft drinks, juices, and other items at wholesale to save money and maximize her profits. Her dream is to improve her home, remodeling it and making it more habitable.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store, and to renovate her home because the rainy season has affected its infrastructure.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is aged 50. She is married with five children between the ages of 20 and 34; they all have married. She sells charcoal and has spent one year in this business. With the loan, she wants to add more sacks of charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sheqer

texts.en:
Sheqer is 53 years old and married. He is the father of four. Sheqer lives in the southern part of Kosovo in a minority community. To earn a living, he works as a woodcutter in his area. The family's current main source of income comes from him. His wife is a housewife taking care of the children. Their house has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy coal to keep the house warm.

Sheqer’s family always feels cold and gets sick in the winter. Sheqer requested a loan in order to do general renovation of the house. He needs to change the roof and to renovate the toilet. The loan will help him to improve conditions for his family. He is hoping to give a better life and education to his children in the future. He is very grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To change his roof and renovate the toilet

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Maame Esi, who is married to a mason and the mother of five children, has been selling kenkey (a traditional corn-based dish that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akonoma, near Cape Coast, for 21 years. Maame Esi, who received no formal education, helps her husband in paying their general bills whilst also supporting their adult children whenever they can.

Her loan will be used to buy more corn, thus helping her prepare more of her kenkey recipe. Maame Esi hopes to use the new profits arising from her business to increase her working capital and expand her kenkey enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more corn, thus helping her prepare more of her kenkey recipe.

loans.name: Mwajine

texts.en:
Mwajine is from Msambweni; she is a very hard-working person who has always worked and strived to reach her goals and objectives. She owns a grocery store in downtown Msambweni; she has had it for more than seven years and comments that it has attained good renown in the neighborhood and thanks to that she has a good clientele. 

She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. Mwajine is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice and other products to stock her store and have good products to offer her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity she is getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice and other products

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 50 años de edad estado civil casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa  y con sus hijos en la ciudad de Ventas Provincia de los Ríos. 

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultora a la siembra de maíz, arroz, a demás se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdos, pato. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, insecticidas, líquido mata plagas, morocho, polvillo vacunas para los pollos ranger.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras los realizan en Ventanas. El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan es no tener terrenos propios. En el tiempo libre se dedica a descansar.
texts.en:
Cesar is 50 years old and is married with 4 children. He lives with his spouse and children in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank Bendición de Dios is located in the rural community of Rancho Grande of the Puerto Pechiche parish. They work in agriculture and livestock.

Cesar works in agriculture, growing corn and rice, and he also raises animals like hens, pigs and ducks. He is asking for this loan to buy urea, insecticide, insect repellent, animal feed, and vaccines for the chickens.

With the help of this loan he will be able to buy necessary inputs for agriculture. He makes his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to get ahead in life thanks to the loans provided by the cooperative. The challenge he faces is not having his own land. He spends his free time relaxing.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, insect repellent, animal feed and vaccines for chickens.

loans.name: Micheline

texts.en: Micheline is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. With the loan, she wants to buy more items to sell in her store such as rice and sugar. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari is 28 years old and from Gaza. He is married and has one child.

He has owned a grocery store since July 2012, and has one employee. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to install new shelves and buy goods.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed and improve his income.

loans.use: to install new shelves and buy goods.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca primarily makes her living selling food items — fruit salads, drinks and basic items. Her neighbors admire her because they consider her to be very self-sacrificing, above all else. Thanks to her efforts, in conjunction with her husband's, they are able to raise their children and give them the education they needed. Thanks to this great effort, their three children all attend school.

Rebecca needs the loan to purchase drinks, dairy products and other items with which she will be able to stock up and have the variety that her customers ask for.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is age 51. She is a widow and has seven children she takes care of. Two of them attend schools. She owns a boutique which she has been running for the past eight years. She wants this loan to add more items such as salt and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as salt and soaps for sale.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 34 years old. She sells sorghum and has been in the business for three years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is a very selfless and humble woman. She has a retail shop that she set up together with her husband more than 10 years ago. Together with her husband, they are serving in the retail shop. She serves all the customers in her area, who prefer her business because of the humble and respectful service she offers them.

Louis requested this loan to buy food products, drinks, dairy products, vegetables, etc., so that she can further supply her store and keep it well stocked.

loans.use: to buy food products, drinks, dairy products, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Zoila Idalia

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 49 años de d edad estado civil unión libre tiene 5 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas  Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Zoila se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, frejol a de mas se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, patos, cerdos. Solicita el credito para comprar de urea, insecticidas, líquido mata plagas, morocho, polvillo vacunas para los cerdos  ranger.

 Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compran los realizan  en Ventanas. El sueño es seguir  a delante gracias al crédito que la  cooperativa  otorgaa los agricultores para seguir progresando. Los desafíos es la falta de la capital de trabajo. Su tiempo libre se dedica a descansar
texts.en:
Zoila is 49 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has 5 children and lives with them and her spouse in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. 

The communal bank Bendición de Dios is located in the rural community of Rancho Grande of the Puerto Pechiche parish. They work in agriculture and livestock.

Zoila works in agriculture, growing corn and beans, and also works raising animals such as hens, ducks and pigs. She is asking for this loan to buy urea, insecticide, insect repellent, animal feed and vaccines for the pigs.

With the help of this loan she will be able to buy necessary inputs for agriculture. She makes her purchases in Ventanas. Her dream is to continue to get ahead, thanks to the loans that the cooperative provides to the farmers to further their progress. The challenge she faces is a lack of working capital. She spends her free time relaxing.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, insect repellent, animal feed and vaccines for pigs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a single mother of four children. All the children currently go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She has a poultry farming business and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a Uganda shilling loan from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed and vaccines. She generates additional income with rental rooms. She works from home and sells wholesale only, seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, disease and transportation of poultry feed. She aspires to own 1500 chickens, to build more rental houses, and also to educate her children up to the university level. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of poultry feed and vaccines

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en: Veneranda is 42 years old. She sells clothing, especially ladies' skirts. With the loan, she wants to buy more skirts and kids' clothing to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and kids' clothing to sell.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en: Madeleine is 27 years old. She owns a bar and has been running the bar for six months. She has requested this loan to buy more beers and sodas to upgrade her pub business. With the profits from the business, she will make more savings for a better future for her business.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is from Msambweni. She is 48 years old and is the companion of Benson. She works selling fruits and vegetables from a little shed in Msambweni. With sacrifice and dedication, she managed to get her three children ahead with the help of her husband. She is a very hardworking woman. She says she has always worked and she is not afraid of challenges. Her goal is to be able to continue growing and to have a bigger shed to continue helping her family and her husband.

Ruth is coming to Yehu Microfinance and to Kiva to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit to be able to supply her business with top quality products to offer.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence is 28 years old. She is married with two children. She sells different merchandise in her store which she has been running for a long time. With this loan, she wants to buy more corn flour, rice and cooking oil to sell. With the profits from the business, she will make more savings. She has been very successful in all the cycles of loans she has obtained.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married, has two children and lives in Msambweni. She works selling merchandise in her village. She buys and sells petrol. She sells in her neighborhood in the store. She comments that all the work she does is to be able to give her children the best, since she does not want them to go through the same deprivations she did.

Mariam is requesting this loan to buy petrol to stock up and be able to fulfill the requests of her customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity she is getting.

loans.use: to buy petrol for resale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 33 years old. She is married with two children, and she works in a business with her husband. She sells different kinds of items in her business. With this new loan, she wants to add items such as corn flour, soap, rice, and sugar to her inventory to sell. She has already planned to use the profits from the business to grow her savings. Marie is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her to upgrade her business and increase her volume of sales.

loans.use: To buy juice, lotion, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is the father of two children aged between five and eight, both of whom attend school. Emmanuel is 39 years old and married. He sells animals and with the loan, he wants to increase the volume of his sales by adding more rabbits, hens, roosters, and ducks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for his business' expansion in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits, roosters, ducks, and hens for sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 57 years old. She sells “Bitenge” - ladies’ clothes. This is her other innovated business, which she thinks will be better than her previous business of animal sales. She is married and her husband is a farmer. Marie wants the loan to buy more "Bitenges" for sale. With the profits, she plans to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more ladies' clothing for selling

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from Msambweni, where she has a small general store and sells used clothing. She tells us that thanks to the variety that she always sells, things are going well; she has developed a good customer base.

She is a hardworking woman; she sacrifices every day by struggling to get ahead so that she can have a better future. She has four children who are in primary school and high school. Mariam tells us that the reason she works tirelessly is for her children.

She is requesting a loan to buy sugar, rice, noodles, breads, beans, and more staples for her store. She is very appreciative for the help from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance for this growth opportunity for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, noodles, breads, beans, and more staples

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 38 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. She wants the loan to add more items, such as soaps, salt, and rice for sale. She has been in the business for two years. The profits from the business will be used to expand her stock and provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more soaps, salt, and rice for selling

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 38 years old. She sells items in her boutique and has been in the business for two years. She wants the loan to add more stuff, such as cooking oil, lotions, and utensils for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, lotions, and utensils for selling

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 37 and married with 6 children between 2 months and 13 years old. Three of them are enrolled in school. With the loan, she wants to buy more potatoes to sell. She will use the profits for expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and has lived with her spouse for 15 years. She has 3 children, all of whom attend school.

Today, Rose has a lot of customers for whom she makes clothing. With the income she obtained, she was able to buy another sewing machine and cloth materials. With the loan she is asking for, she plans on financing herself a little better in her profession by buying more machines and getting raw materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and cloth materials

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 37 years old. She sells vegetables and fruits. She would like to get the loan to add more beans and different kinds of fruits for sale. She is planning to reinvest in the same business after obtaining the profits.

loans.use: to buy more beans and fruits for selling

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is an enterprising young client. She is 30 years old and has been married for years. She and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school.

Saumu has owned her business for three years. She previously devoted herself as a full-time farmer while her husband was working, but she decided to open a food pantry to take advantage of the fact that there were no other places in her neighborhood to buy groceries or basic necessities. Saumu started out selling essential items and later increased her assortment of merchandise to include meats and beverages.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of a variety of products, such as rice, meat, canned goods, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products, like rice, meat, canned goods, and other items

loans.name: Mrichwa

texts.en:
Mrichwa is 63 years old. For more than 10 years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables, which she buys at the market. At 7 am, she takes her children to the bus stop and then goes to sell her products in the businesses of her neighborhood.

She will use the loan to buy a larger amount of fruit and vegetables. She thanks Kiva lenders and Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance, for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a railing for the stairwell, cots, pillows and bedding for additional children, age-appropriate educational toys, tables and chairs for workstation areas and eating times, and to renovate the bathroom for children.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a longtime owner of a small crafts and yarn store in her village. For quite some time now, she has been looking into ways to diversify her stock and increase her income. Amal also creates crafts, jewelry and designs, but her shop is so tiny that there is no room for new displays or for new products.

Amal had the opportunity to move her store to a new larger location, in a building her late parents left to her and her brothers. The family divided the building and Amal has the street entrance store. The location is more central, not far from her original shop, but more convenient for customers and also in an area with foot traffic. It is larger and provides much better opportunity for sales.

Amal needed this loan to assist in paying for renovations, electricity changes, bathroom and fitting room renovations, flooring, paint and windows.

Amal has the opportunity to increase her income simply through the move. Even if she keeps her existing products, the location and layout make for much more customer potential. It also gives her the opportunity to sell the products she creates at full profit. In the future, she wants to introduce new products including evening gowns and specialty clothes.

loans.use: to pay for electricity changes, bathroom and fitting room renovations, flooring, paint and windows for her crafts and yarn store.

loans.name: Mujeres Hacia El Futuro 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Yemeris is the coordinator of her group which is called Mujeres Hacia el Futuro 1, 2 & 3. She is a single mother with a child who lives with her in a simply structured home. This group is located in the rural village of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugarcane industry. The main economic activity here is the free-trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses.

Yemeris has been selling silver and gold-filled jewelry for approximately one year with the first loan she took with Esperanza International. She plans to use this loan to buy more jewelry like rings, bracelets, necklaces and other jewelry. She will reinvest the profits in her business so she can expand her sales and supply more clients, and also so that she can provide for her child. This is her second loan with Esperanza International, and she is very excited about it. She has been investing all of her loans in her business. Yemeris thanks you all for your support of her group's dreams.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets and necklaces to sell.

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en: Sasun has been engaged in animal breeding for many years. He breeds cows, calves, lambs and chickens. He provides his customers with dairy products, meat and eggs. Sasun’s wife helps him in this occupation. Sasun is pleased with his farming activities as they bring him sufficient profit for his family. He lives in Gugark village which is in Vanadzor area. He has two children: a daughter and a son. His daughter is married and lives separately from her parents. Sasun’s son is in the military, serving in the Armenian Army. Sasun needs a loan to buy fodder for his animals and to buy one calf. He expects to earn more profits in the future and dreams of collecting a lot of money for his children's good future.

loans.use: to buy a calf and fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Solenny is one of the members of the Canal de Bendicion 2 & 4 group, a group in which the majority of members are Haitian immigrants who live in the city of La Romana, where the economy depends on the sugar industry and on luxury tourism. The businesses sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics and food.

Solenny is very excited to receive her tenth loan from Esperanza International, after having satisfactorily repaid her previous loans and having taken steps towards growing her business. She has had her business for almost 5 years, when she began selling miscellaneous products. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of new women's clothes such as jeans, pants, blouses, underwear and skirts. 

Solenny is single and she is studying because she wants to become a professional. She tells us that her biggest challenge is to be able to finish her studies. She lives with her parents. She really enjoys studying and selling clothes. She plans to use her earnings to reinvest in her business and to save to pay for anything she needs for her studies. She dreams of having a clothing store and to be able to get married.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ganchudur

texts.en:
Ganchudur is 37 years old and lives with his family in Dornod, the eastern-most province of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on fenced land. 

Ganchudur has been working as a driver at a mining and resource business entity for five years. His colleagues acknowledge him as one of the best workers and they respect him greatly. He also renders taxi services to local people during his free time. 

The house and fences that the family owns, have been deteriorating over the years and need some improvements. So, Ganchudur is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as cement, bricks and planks. Renovating his house will enable the family to burn less coal during winter time, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. Ganchudur is a very hardworking individual who alone generates his whole family's income.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as cement, bricks and planks to improve his house and surrounding fences.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 57 years old, and is married with two children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for a period of one year. She is very excited about her business. 

She has requested the loan to buy more sorghum for sale - (sorghum is a type of grain). 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. Agnes is very happy with her previous Kiva loan, with which she managed to set up this new business of selling sorghum.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell in her business.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Mena sells kokonty (a traditional Ghanaian dish made up of dried cassava chips) in Akonoma near Cape Coast. She has been selling kokonty for a little over two years. Her husband is a mason. Mena uses her income to help pay some of her family's expenses and save for her children's future. Mena will use the loan to purchase more kokonty to sell in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena plans to develop her kokonty business further.

loans.use: to purchase more kokonty to sell in the market

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 38 years old. She is married with four children, who all go to school.

Athanasie sells charcoal and has been in the business for eight years. She would like a loan so she can purchase more charcoal to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans to save more money.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane tells us that she works twice as hard so that she can provide her children with everything they need for living with dignity and without the deprivation she had to go through. She sacrifices herself, because she wishes to see her children become well-adjusted people who are useful not only to themselves but to society as well.

Jane requests the loan in order to purchase flour, milk, noodles, rice, sugar and other items. This will allow her to stock up her store and keep it well assorted so that she can continue to offer her customers a wide variety of merchandise. 

She gives thanks to Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva for the opportunity she and her children are getting, since she is by herself and she will benefit greatly from this help.

loans.use: to purchase flour, milk, noodles, rice, sugar and other items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Janchiv

texts.en:
Mr. Janchiv, 48 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on fenced land. He has been running an automobile repair shop for seven consecutive years. In wintertime, the number of customers decreases drastically, so he produces and sells cookers to local people. The automobile repair shop he owns has been heated by a low pressure heater and the authority of Darkhan city requested he install a central heating system for energy efficiency. So, Mr. Janchiv is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 tugriks to install a central heating system in his automobile repair shop.

The advantage of the installment of a heating system is that it offers a more environmentally-friendly solution than a direct electric heating device. This stems from the fact that most electricity originates remotely using fossil fuels, with up to two-thirds of the energy in the fuel lost at the power station and in transmission losses. Typical efficiencies for central heating are: 85-97% for gas-fired heating; 80-89% for oil-fired, and 45-60% for coal-fired heating. Based on these facts, installment of a heating system in the automobile repair shop will enable Mr. Janchiv to spend less on energy consumption.

loans.use: to install a central heating system in his automobile repair shop

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 53 years old, and is married with six children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a farm on which she grows vegetables to sell in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 7,000PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
With only seven members left, the Kembang Kertas group continue to borrow loans to increase their businesses. They were motivated by their friend who has already succeeded to run a business by themselves.

Ni Nengah used her loan to purchase piglets and feed. Being motivated by her friend, she manages her business better then before and hopes for a satisfactory profit. Her goal is that she can have enough capital to run the business. 

One member cannot attend the meeting because of a religious ceremony at her temple.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Chuluunbaatar is 31 years old, and lives with his family in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own old house on fenced land. His wife has been working as saleswoman at trade center. He himself has been working as machinist at a monastery since 2008. 

As his children are growing bigger each passing day, his current house is not providing enough space for the whole family, and has deteriorated over the years. So he has decided to build a brand new house on his recently purchased land. But due to a lack of finance, he has delayed the construction of the house. 

He is requesting a loan of 6,800,000 MNT to purchase building materials, including but not limited to cement, bricks, planks and metals. As a result of building a new house, they can move to their new house and in winter time, they will burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials in order to build a house.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa's determination pushes her to strive hard to obtain her goal in life. She is married with one child. Teresa has run a variety store for more than 10 years. She is thankful because her perseverance and patience resulted in a little success.

Teresa's previous loans helped her a lot, most especially in improving her financial stability and way of life. This time, she still aims for a continuous smooth flow of her business. For this reason, she is asking for another loan amounting to 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She will use this amount in buying stock of grocery items such as eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles and shampoo. Teresa hopes for approval of her requested loan amount in order for her to obtain better profit and progressive business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as eggs, cooking oil, soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles and shampoo for her variety store.

loans.name: Aga

texts.en: Aga is 54 years old and still single. Aga is a hardworking person who is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for almost 10 years and usually earns about 2,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) per piglet. She wants to have more piglets to raise. In this regard, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy additional hogs to raise, and feed for them. Aga hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise, and feed for them.

loans.name: Nheok

texts.en:
Nheok is a resident living in Kompong Speu province. She is married with two grown-up children; her daughter works in a handbag factory in the province, earning a payment of USD $90 monthly, and her son is employed as a driver for a private company to financially support the family. However, Nheok doesn’t rely on her children’s income. Together with her husband, she is involved in land cultivation. She particularly grows and harvests rice to serve her family as food and to sell in the market.

Now Nheok needs some financial support to buy a motorcycle to satisfy their transportation needs, especially for her children commuting to work every day. This will enable her family to cut down unnecessary expenses and instead, they can save more for improving their family’s living conditions. In the future, Nheok plans to expand her business activities, purchase farm machinery and make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to satisfy her family's transportation needs.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Hog raising is the primary source of income for Rogelio. He has been a hog raiser for five years. Rogelio is 48 years old now and is married, with three school-aged children. At this time, Rogelio is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 37,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of his hog. He hopes that he can obtain his desired loan to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the proper growth of his hog

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep was born in 1974. She has two children. The older child is learning at university. The younger child is a football player. She and her husband have a grocery store to earn a living. She has done this job for 10 years. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 11,118,000 VND to buy noodles, biscuits, candies and soft drinks to sell in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, candies, soft drinks and groceries to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en: Sonny, 48 years of age, is married to Crisencia. He has operated his hog-raising business in their village for almost five years, and he earns approximately 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per head every four months. He wanted to request a loan from Kiva lenders of 28,000 PHP to purchase additional hogs to raise, and feed for them. He is determined and patient to improve his business to supplement the needs of his family. His profit will be used as additional working capital for his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs to raise, and feed for them.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 59 years old. She lives with her family in the village of Salvacion. Erlinda raises pigs and also farms rice and corn. She has requested a loan of 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase feed and additional piglets to support her business. Her goal is to expand her pig-raising business to maintain her income and support the needs of her family. Erlinda said she must be strong and work hard in order to achieve her dreams, just like well-known entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional piglets to support her business.

loans.name: Tsedenbal

texts.en: Tsedenbal, 60 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Kherlen, a city located in the easternmost province of Mongolia. His daughter works as a waitress at a restaurant and his son studies at college. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since his retirement from military service. The family resides in their own old house on fenced land. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. Using his previous loan, he has repaired his house roof and now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials to repair and expand his house. As a result, the family will be able to live in a more comfortable and warmer place, which will enable the family to burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who always gives life lessons to his children such as how to live right and how to work from his heart etc.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for his house roof repair.

loans.name: Oanh's Group

texts.en:
Oanh was born in 1959. She has a son and a daughter. They have their own families. Her husband is retired. His pension is about 3,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong). Oanh grows rice and raises chickens to earn a living. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food for poultry. She also wants to use the money to buy seed.
 
The other group member, Vien, is 54 years old. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her area for nursing.

loans.name: Elias Ramon

texts.es:
Elías tiene 32 años de edad estado civil soltero vive con sus hermanos en la ciudad de ventanas Provincia de los Rios.

La VRC Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Elías se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz a de mas se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, patos. 

Solicita el cerdito para comprar de urea, insecticidas, líquido mata plagas, morocho, vacunas para los cerdos.
  
Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compran los realizan en Ventanas. El sueño es salir a delante gracias al crédito que nos otorga la cooperativa. Los desafíos es la falta de la capital de trabajo. Su tiempo libre se dedica a descansar.
texts.en:
Elías is 32 years old and is single. He lives with his brothers in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios.

The communal bank Bendición de Dios (God’s Blessing) is located in the community of Rancho Grande in the Puerto Pechiche Parish. They work as agricultural laborers and livestock farmers.

Elías works in agriculture growing corn, rice, and others. He raises animals like hens and ducks. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase urea, insecticides, pest-killing liquid, corn, and vaccines for pigs. 

With the assistance from the loan, he will be able to purchase necessary agricultural items. He will make the purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to get ahead, thanks to the loan that the co-op is offering. His challenges include a lack of working capital. His free time is spent resting.

loans.use: to purchase urea, insecticide, pest-killing liquid, corn, and vaccines for pigs.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is married with one child. He is 27 years old and lives in Balide, Aurora. Randy is operating a retail store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years and every month he earns 30,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee and rice. In 2010, Randy joined GDMPC. Randy hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee and rice.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has been a good borrower since she started borrowing her additional capital. She is now 58 years of age and married with five children. Four of her children have married and have their own families while the other one is a business-oriented person.

Josefina's main goal is to have a stable source of income since she's already getting old. To make her dreams come true, she is requesting another loan, amounting to 15,000 PHP. This amount will be used to buy stock of merchandise and vegetables for her general store. She hopes and prays that this loan amount will help her in expanding her business so she may improve her way of life and financial status.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise and vegetables for her general store.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros and her husband are blessed with four children. They live in the village of Salvacion. Milagros raises pigs and also farms rice and corn. She has requested a loan of 48,000 PHP to purchase feed and additional piglets to support her business. Her goal is to expand her pig-raising business to maintain her income and support the needs of her family. Milagros said she must be strong and work hard in order to achieve her dreams, just like well-known entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional piglets to support her business.

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru:
Поддержка фонда КИВА помогло развить бизнес и увеличить обороты. На сегодняшний день в магазине Джумагул широко представлены как продукты питания так и мыло-моющие средства. Доходы Джумагул на сегодняшний день составляют около 15,000 KGS. Увеличение доходов положительно отразились на благосостоянии семьи. Семья Джумагуль благодарна за поддержку. Джумагул обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на расширение бизнеса за счет покупки оборудования для магазина и увеличения ассортимента товаров.
Если проект будет столь успешным как и первый проект то Джумагуль планирует приобрести мебель для дома.
texts.en: The support of Kiva helped Djumagul expand her business and increase her turnover.  Today, she sells a wide variety of goods like foods, soaps and detergents.  Her income is now around 15,000 KGS.  The income from the loan has had a positive impact on the family's welfare.  Djumagul's family is grateful for the support.  Now she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 KGS to expand her store's selection of goods as well as to buy needed equipment.  If this endeavor is as successful as the first, Djumagul plans to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to expand her product selection

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en: Leonilo is 45 years old with 5 children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over 10 years and earns 35,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2007, and now he has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en: Tito is 48 years old and married with three children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in this business for over four years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in 2007, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha: 54, and a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Constantino, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Editha owns and oversees operations of their Jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one Jeepney unit (14-16 person capacity), which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her Jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Editha dreams to have more jeepneys and hopes that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that truly makes the Philippines the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her Jeepney unit.

loans.name: August

texts.en: August is 36 years old and is married with two children. To make a living, August is engaged in the hog-raising business. He has been gaining experience in this field for almost five years. He usually earns about 2,500 PHP per piglet. Right now, August is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of his hogs.

loans.name: Uruya

texts.ru: Уруя 52 года, вдова, воспитала 7 детей. Уруя на протяжении 11 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 12,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Уруя в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 4 лошади, 2 жеребят 1 теленок, 35 овец с ягнятами и 1 коза с ягненком. Ежемесячный доход от перепродажи скота  составляет 17,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уруя обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец для откорма. Доходы от кредита Уруя планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Uruya is a 52-year-old widow who has raised 7 children. For 11 years now, she has been working in animal husbandry, having started her business with a sum of 12,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, her farm now includes 3 cows, 4 horses, 2 colts, 1 calf, 35 sheep with lambs, and 1 goat with a kid. Her monthly income from the re-sale of cattle is 17,000 Som. For the purpose of developing her business, Uruya has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 Som to purchase calves and sheep for fattening. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to further increase the number of domestic cattle she has.

loans.use: To purchase calves and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is a woman who has had a hard fate. She is 48 years old. Her husband died six years ago. Her husband was a kind and lovely man who provided his family with all necessary things. He was an entrepreneur. He had a garden where he grew apples, and Mahbuba helped him. After the death of her husband, Mahbuba stayed with her two children. She began her business with animal husbandry to provide her children with food and education. She has been busy with animal husbandry for a number of years, but her income is not enough for improving their living conditions. She plans to start her new business growing and selling apples. Her son and daughter-in-law will help her with managing the business. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy apple seedlings for starting her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy apple seedlings for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 61 год, вдова. С Розой проживает сын и внучка. Роза на протяжении 15 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Розы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 голов КРС и 13 овец, продажа молока и молочных продуктов и перепродажа скота составляет 10,000 сом в месяц. Дополнительно Роза ежегодно сажает картофель, сеют зерновые культуры на 5,31 га земли. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Roza is a 61-year-old widow. Her son and granddaughter live with her. For the last 15 years, Roza has been working in animal husbandry and growing crops, having started this business with a sum of 15,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, her farm now includes 4 head of cattle and 13 sheep, and the monthly income from the sale of milk, dairy products, and cattle is 10,000 Som. In addition, she also plants potatoes every year and grows grains on a 5.31 hectare plot of land. For the purpose of developing her business, Roza has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 65,000 Som to purchase cattle for fattening and re-sale. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to further increase the number of domestic cattle she has.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en:
Entering their fourth loan cycle, most of the members of the Melati Putih group have sows and local pigs which are sold for pig barbeque. The local pigs are sold at two months old. 

As the head of the group, Kadek become a good example for her friends. Now she plans to purchase super quality feeds for her pigs. She has a sow and it will give birth soon. She is preparing for the piglets. She will sell the piglets for fattening. 

She’s really happy and thankful to Kiva, MUK and the lenders for supporting her business and also the group. Now she can contribute to the income made by her husband, to fulfill the family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase super quality feeds.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 51, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a driver and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elizabeth operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Aside from her food stall, she also sells charcoal. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. 

Elizabeth dreams of expanding her business and having more customers. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
This is Marta, 55, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Geronimo, a taxi driver and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marta hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of having good health and a deeper relationship with God. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway is 42 years old and is married to Manny. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with four children. To raise her family, Liwayway engaged herself in hog-raising business. She has been in this business for two years, and usually receives a net income of PHP 7,000 per hog every 4 to 5 months. 

To this end, Liwayway is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Myagmardagva

texts.en:
Mr. Myagmardagva, 50 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on fenced land. He has been running a business transporting building materials within Ulaanbaatar city using his own truck. All of his children are married and live separately from their parents. 

Using his previous loan, he repaired his house's roof and began using his house as a grocery store. Even though the roof is repaired, the house's current appearance is undermining the efforts to attract customers. So he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cements and planks to renovate the house. As a result, his grocery store will attract customers greatly due to its good appearance. This will also enable them to burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is quite innovative as he lives in his house at the same time as using it as a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as cements, bricks and planks.

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en:
Borrower Mr. Myagmarjav is a 46-year-old married man who lives with his family in the outer ger district of the city. He works as a shift boss with his spouse at a local company. He has two daughters and both of them are finished with their studies. 

The house in which the family currently lives is very old and requires some renovation work. In Mongolia, the spring season is the best season for renovating and building houses.  

Thus he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary construction materials in order to renovate his old unsafe house and make it into a good one.

loans.use: to renovate his old unsafe house and to make better living conditions for his family.

loans.name: Kaloline

texts.en:
Kaloline is 43 years old and married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community and at the market. She has been doing this for many years.

Kaloline needs a loan to buy some bush knives, plant sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Kaloline will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, fertilizers and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1969. She has four children. Her two older sons are carpenters. Her daughter is learning at university. Her youngest child is learning at high school. Her husband is a constructor and earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Dung is a carpenter. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 10 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry. She wants to use the profit to buy furniture for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood to do carpentry.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen was born in 1988. She has two little daughters. Her husband and she are carpenters. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy wood to do carpentry. She wants to raise her children and help them to grow up well through the profit from her business.

loans.use: to buy wood to do carpentry.

loans.name: Uputo

texts.en: Uputo is a 42 year old married woman with 3 children. She makes and sells ice cream in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience in this business. Uputo needs a loan to buy foam cups, a tank, ice, a sack of sugar and a freezer. She plans to use her profits to support her family and improve her business. Uputo has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, a sack of sugar, ice, a tank and a freezer.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong was born in 1987. She has a little daughter. Her husband is a carpenter. His income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. Huong helps with his business and is also a farmer to earn a living. She has done this job for 5 years. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND per month as well. 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She will use her expected profits to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su tía ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja toda la noche por más de ocho horas como conductor asalariado ya que no cuenta con vehiculó propio. Ya que con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar un par de computadoras ya que desea abrir un negocio de internet y de esa forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Roberto es comprarse un vehículo propio, ampliar el negocio de internet y mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a Impro y la primera vez con Kiva.
texts.en:
Roberto is single and doesn't have any children.  He lives in just one room in his aunt's house.  The house is located in the Tembladerani district of the city of La Paz.  

Roberto currently works all night, for more than eight hours.  He works as a paid driver because he doesn't yet have his own vehicle.  With the income he makes, he has to cover his food costs and pay for basic services.

Roberto needs this loan to buy a couple of computers as he would like to open an Internet cafe and improve both his income and his quality of life.  This is the first time that he has worked with Impro and the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a couple of computers so that he can open an Internet cafe and improve his income

loans.name: Laina

texts.en:
Laina is 28 years old and married with three children. She owns and operates a business venture, a taxi business. She has two years of experience in this line of business. 

Laina needs a loan to buy seat covers for her taxi, new tire replacements and to renew the taxi license registration. She hopes to use her profits to fulfill her family needs. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, spare tires and renew her car license.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Trifina

texts.en:
Trifina is married with three grown-up children. All her children have married and have their own families. Trifina and her husband both work hard in order to earn enough to make a living. 

Trifina manages a retail store within her local community. At her age, 58 years old, she aspires to make it a stable source of her income. So she's doing her best in order to achieve this. According to her, she wants to increase the volumes of merchandise she offers within her local community but her capital for her store is no longer enough.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan of PHP 20,000. She will use this amount to buy merchandise such as cooking oil, sugar, coffee, eggs and canned goods for her retail store. She believes that her success relies on adaptation to new marketing strategies and continuous access to financial services from lenders. She is hoping for continuous improvement of her retail store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cooking oil, sugar, coffee, eggs and canned goods for her retail store.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 59 years old and a widow with five children. She owns and operates a business venture, a flea market. She has three years of experience in this line of business. 

Filipina needs a loan to buy fabric materials of traditional design to make more clothes for her business. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and to be able to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy new fabrics of traditional design.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is well known in her village as a good citizen. She is 39 years of age and is married to Orlando. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with two school-aged children. 

To raise her family, Jonalyn is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been doing this activity for over three years. She wants to have more hogs to raise, but she lack the necessary capital. In this regard, Jonalyn is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them. She hopes to grow her business as well as their family status.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Maoiai

texts.en:
Maoiai is 54 years old and married with eight children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. 

Maoiai needs a loan to buy some bush knives, plant sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Maoiai will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, fertilizers and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in business for over 3 years and earns about 8,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Paola Rosaura

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pequeño hijo y sus padres, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que Paola es madre y padre para él; gracias a su esfuerzo Paola pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo a la Plancha para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Paola trabaja como digitadora en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Paola se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos del tramite documentario para obtener su título técnico, de esta manera Paola contar con una mejor calificación y podrá estar mejorar preparada para tener un mejor trabajo, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Paola is a 22-year-old woman who lives in the city of Nazca with her young son and her parents.  She loves her son, who is her pride and joy.  Paola is a very friendly, keen, hard-working woman who puts all her efforts into providing for her little one as she is both mother and father to him.  Thanks to her hard work, Paola was able to study for a technical degree in Computing and Information Technology.  In her spare time, she enjoys watching television and sometimes cooks a delicious grilled chicken to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, and with a lot of determination and commitment, Paola works as a typist for a company in her city.  She works every day for approximately 8 hours.  She believes that she is successful because she carries out her work well and is friendly to others.

Paola is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to cover the cost of submitting all the documentation needed to receive her technical degree.  Paola will then have a better qualification and will be better prepared for finding a better job.  She will continue working and striving to become a good professional.

loans.use: to cover the costs of obtaining her technical degree

loans.name: Fuisa

texts.en: Fuisa is a 42-year-old married woman with 10 children. She makes and sells ice cake in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Fuisa needs a loan to buy plastic cups, a tank, an ice bell, sacks of sugar and a deep freezer. She plans to use her profits to support her family and improve her business. Fuisa has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy cups, sacks of sugar and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 46 years old. She is married and has three children. Marivic is engaged in a direct selling business. She has been in her business for almost seven years. She usually sells cologne, clothes, shoes, lotion and deodorant in her village. Right now she wants a loan of P10,000 to buy new items, such as clothes, lotion, powder and shoes, to sell in the village. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy new items, such as clothes, lotion, powder and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and lives with her husband and kids. She says that she received help from her husband in order to start her business. Thanks to this, she was able to set up a butcher shop. Owing to her determination and hard work, in addition to her attentiveness, it grew rapidly. Currently, she has a solid customer base.

The requested loan will be put toward the purchase of a refrigerator for better conservation of her products. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the help that she has received, as this is an excellent opportunity for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for better conservation of her products.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a thirty-nine-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. For two years now she has been in a produce business. She started the business in order to supplement her farming activities which are seasonal and cannot meet the family's daily needs. A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University and to set up sustainable income generating activities for them. Her business plan is to venture into modern farming and have an ag food store that can sustainably supply her customers all year round. Margret intends to use the loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a retail business which is selling cosmetics products (Avon dealer) to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns about 5,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000PHP to purchase additional cosmetics products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics products to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is from the village of Antonino. He is 39 years old and married, and he has two school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a furniture-making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling cabinets and wardrobe furniture to local businesses and community members. Alexander has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. Right now, he is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. He hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 49 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 7 years and earns about 5,500 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. And now she has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, soap and shampoo. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from the village of Magsaysay, Alicia. She is a widow. Lorna has two children. Lorna found it hard to find job, so she decided to open a sari-sari, or general store. She has been in business for almost two years and earns about 300 PHP a day. She would like to have more stock on hand to sell.
Lorna is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy noodles, bread, cookies, candies and condiments to sell. She believes that with this loan she will be able to improve her store as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, bread, cookies, candies and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 50 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells firewood in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for over 6 years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Her requested loan will be used to acquire additional firewood. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felister is 55 years old and in the farming business. She is blessed with six children. She has been in the business for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES. 10,000.
This marks her first loan term with KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizers for use on her farm. With the profits, she will purchase more cows for her dairy business.
She hopes to purchase a piece of land to construct a permanent residential house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a 44-year-old farmer. She is single mother of one child. She has been farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES. 13,000. She uses this to support her family.
Florah is applying for her fourth loan term with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and part of the loan to pay for her child’s college fees. Her hopes and dreams are to give her son the best education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for her son's college fees.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph used the previous loan to pay the school fees for his children. He is a hardworking man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a newspaper vendor and with the profits he has been able to pay school fees and buy land. He faces the challenge of low pay while his dreams are to build a house for residence and become the leading newspaper distributor in the area. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy building materials for construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for construction of his house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 49 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with six children who are aged between 16 years and six years old.

Joseph is a farmer and has been in it for the past five years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers to use on his farm.

He hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, 32, is determined to overcome poverty by expanding her pig-raising business so that she can earn more money and continue to pay the cost of keeping her children in school. 

She has been in this business for almost sixteen years and spends most of the money she earns on food, clothing and allowances for her children. To improve her business and increase her earnings, Marivic is asking for a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy the feed, medicine and vitamins she needs to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and vitamins.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 36 years old, married and with four children. She lives in Clarin, MIsamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.
